course_description: This course prepares students to engage in theoretically and practically based discourse and decision making in ethical issues involved in clinical and biomedical research. The course will survey a variety of ethical issues occurring in basic and applied research settings and analyze approaches that seek to prevent or resolve them. Classes will primarily consist of the faculty and students leading discussions around various articles and case studies.
